instruction: What kinds of spectrum was used in the related research on the optical damage of terminal optical components?
Output: The research on the optical damage of terminal optical components used near-infrared spectroscopy.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the related research on the optical damage of terminal optical components?
Output: Mean centering, smoothing, Multiplicative Scatter Correction (MSC), Standard Normal Variable Transformation (SNV), and detrending (DT) were used as spectral feature processing methods in the related research on the optical damage of terminal optical components.

instruction: What metric was chosen to classify and identify the damage types of terminal optical components?
Output: Machine learning was used to classify and identify the damage types of terminal optical components.

instruction: What machine learning models were used in the research on the optical damage of terminal optical components in order to improve the identification model and reduce the complexity of the spectral model?
Output: Machine learning models were used in the research on the optical damage of terminal optical components to improve the identification model and reduce the complexity of the spectral model.

instruction: Can the proposed method using machine learning and infrared nondestructive testing be used to develop an online detection system for the terminal optical element in the Shenguang III system, with a focus on detecting optical damage, extracting damage information, and classifying damage types?
Output: Yes, the proposed method using machine learning and infrared nondestructive testing can be used to develop an online detection system for the terminal optical element in the Shenguang III system. The method focuses on detecting optical damage, extracting damage information, and classifying damage types. The research results show that this method has certain effects, indicating its potential for use in the online detection system.
